Valencia intend to make another approach for Benoît Badiashile

RMC Sport report that Spanish outfit Valencia intend to make another approach for 18-year-old AS Monaco central defender Benoît Badiashile this month.

The Spaniards are waiting for the final week of the window before making a formal proposal – ASM don’t intend to separate themselves from the teenager this month, but the club’s representatives are not completely closed off to a discussion, as under Robert Moreno it looks likely that Badiashile will not receive consequential playing time.

VCF are willing to offer up to €25m for the Frenchman this month, which is likely to fall short of the asking price of up to €50m that Badiashile was fetching already last summer.

Barcelona defender Jean-Clair Todibo expected to join Schalke on loan; final details being hashed out

Negotiations between Schalke and Barcelona for the loan of France youth international defender Jean-Clair Todibo are still ongoing, according to Sport1.

The 20-year-old flew into Düsseldorf airport on Sunday evening and was met by a Schalke representative to undergo final talks, with the final details being hashed out.

Schalke want to sign Todibo on loan until the end of the season but also want to include an option to buy clause in the contract. This is something that Barcelona are stalling on, with sporting director Eric Abidal recently stating that Todibo is a key player for the future.

With just the final details left to be clarified, if Schalke are unable to get a purchase clause included, they are hoping to make it an 18 month loan deal.

FC Köln target Lokomotiv Moscow defender Benedikt Höwedes

Kicker report that Bundesliga club FC Köln are showing an interest in signing Lokomotiv Moscow defender Benedikt Höwedes.

The World Cup winner is looking to leave the Russian club, preferring a return to Germany.

However, a loan wouldn’t be financially feasible for Köln unless the 31-year-old defender takes a substantial wage cut.

Flamengo keen on Fiorentina's Pedro: clubs to have meeting on Wednesday

Brazilian striker Pedro could leave Fiorentina just five months after his arrival at the Artemio Franchi from Fluminense. The 22 year-old forward, who played a total of 59 minutes this season, has in fact become a target of Flamengo.

On Wednesday morning, the officials from Fiorentina and the Brazilian side will hold a meeting in Florence in order to discuss a possible deal and try to reach an agreement on with the form of a permanent transfer.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/flamengo-keen-on-fiorentinas-pedro-clubs-to-have-meeting-on-wednesday

Inter, Roma: Politano not called-up as Spinazzola swap discussions advance

Matteo Politano will not be among Antonio Conte's call-ups for Inter's Coppa Italia match against Cagliari tonight at San Siro. This is a new and important signal that his sale is nearing completion or how the discussions with Roma -- Spinazzola's name is rumored to be involved in the deal -- are in a phase so advanced that it's a risk to send him onto the pitch.

After Zaniolo's injury, Roma has focused their attention onto Politano: negotiations prepared in 24 hours over the course of Monday, with Leonardo Spinazzola ready to transfer to Inter. The final details still need to be ironed out, but Roma and Inter and heading toward the white smoke for the Politano-Spinazzola swap with more developments possibly coming today.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/inter-roma-politano-not-called-up-as-spinazzola-swap-discussions-advance

The Colombian defender is now set to join Celta Vigo, he has previously played in Spain at Barcelona and Valencia. Murillo will leave this afternoon to take the medical after the clubs agreed to a loan deal with option to buy set at €16 million, as his replacement Sampdoria are expected to sign Lorenzo Tonelli who is looking for more playing time after his experience at Napoli.

Milan tempted by Roma's Cengiz Under: the latest


After Ibrahimovic and Kjaer, Milan are also tempted by Roma's Cengiz Under. It was a profile that was already discussed last summer and it still remains in the Rossoneri's thought process. It remains a temptation because Roma are not convinced of the formula of the proposed transfer. The Turkish player is no longer a main part of the squad, but he may get more playing time after Zaniolo's injury. Under is still a big investment for Roma and they won't entertain the thought of selling without the right offer. The thought is still there, but realizing it remains a dream for now.

Milan, PSV set on Ricardo Rodriguez: price set

The negotiations between Milan and PSV for Ricardo Rodriguez will come down to how much financial muscle the Dutch club wants to flex. Milan set the price today and now it remains to be seen if it will be met.

The meeting that took place today at Casa Milan today was positive. The rossoneri directors and agent of the player were both present. The desire of PSV was also on display, and now Milan has set the terms: a permanent transfer now in January or a loan with obligation to purchase fixed at 6 million.

Schalke to confirm 18-month loan of Jean-Clair Todibo (Barcelona) with purchase option

Schalke are expected to announce the signing of Jean-Clair Todibo from Barcelona on an 18-month loan deal with an option to buy, according to Sport Bild.

Sky Germany correspondent and Schalke expert Dirk Schlarmann confirms the report but also states that Barcelona will have a buy-back clause, which can be activated in 2022.

RB Leipzig hold talks to sign Las Palmas goalkeeper Josep Martínez

Bild report that RB Leipzig are in negotiations to sign Las Palmas goalkeeper Josep Martínez in the summer.

The 21-year-old trained at Barcelona until 2017 before joining Las Palmas’ B team, making his first team debut in 2019. Martínez is also a member of the Spain U21 team.

RB Leipzig hope to complete a deal in January before loaning back Martínez for the remainder of the season.

Reports in Spain believe the transfer fee to be €2.5 million.

Negotiations ongoing between FC Köln & Lokomotiv Moscow for Benedikt Höwedes

FC Köln are expected to make a decision on Lokomotiv Moscow defender Benedikt Höwedes on Wednesday, according to Kicker.

The 31-year-old wants a return to Germany and whilst Köln are searching for a new defender, negotiations between the clubs are too far apart when it comes to a loan or permanent transfer.

Per the report, Höwedes would be willing to take a pay cut.

Hatem Ben Arfa currently has 2 offers: Almeria & a Middle Eastern club

Our colleagues at Eurosport report that 32-year-old free agent and winger Hatem Ben Arfa currently has two offers on the table in this January window.

Talks with La Liga side Real Valladolid have slowed, but HBA has a concrete offer from second division side Almeria on the table. Ben Arfa’s preferred destination has been Spain since summer, but it is unlikely that he would’ve considered the 2nd tier in this country.

His other concrete proposal comes from an unnamed Saudi Arabian side, who are offering the player a lucrative short-term deal.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2020/hatem-ben-arfa-currently-has-2-offers-almeria-a-middle-eastern-club/

Roma and Milan working on Under-Suso swap: the latest

Roma and Milan are working on a swap between Cengiz Under and Suso. It is a possiblity after both clubs were interested in the individual players. While waiting to finalize the Politano deal, Roma continue to make inquiries and Suso keeps coming up as an option. The swap could happen between the two clubs, as the Turkish player wants more playing time and his agents are pushing for a sale. On the other hand, Suso could be one of the player leaving, as he was greeted with boos from the San Siro when he came on against Spal in the Coppa Italia. The possible solution could be an exchange of loans with an option to buy. It could be a way for both players to recover some confidence that was lost in Rome and Milano.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/roma-and-milan-working-on-under-suso-swap-the-latest

Inter, the latest on Giroud and Eriksen negotiations

Inter director of football Piero Ausilio's has returned to Italy after his trip to London to continue the negotiations for Olivier Giroud and Christian Eriksen with both players willing to join the Nerazzurri.

During his trip to London Ausilio met with Eriksen's agent, who reiterated the player's desire to join Inter in January. Now the Nerazzurri will have to try to lower Tottenham's demands. Inter have made a €10 million opening offer, while Spurs have set their asking price to €20 million. The Italian club would prefer not to exceed the €15 million treshold and intermediaries are working on reaching an agreement.

On the Giroud front, Chelsea are adamant that won't accept less than €5 million euros plus €1 million in bonuses to let the French striker leave. For their part, Inter won't offer more than 4 million euros plus 1 additional million in bonuses. In order to unlock the situation, Giroud sent out a significal signal of his desire to join Inter as he is open to lower his wage demands by €500.000 per year on the 2-year-and-a-half contract that Inter are offering him. The Nerazzurri will close the deal after completing the sale of Politano to Roma.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/inter-the-latest-on-giroud-and-eriksen-negotiations

Politano-Spinazzola swap still stalling: the details

The negotations between Inter and Roma for the Politano-Spinazzola swap deal have reached an impasse as both clubs stand firm in their respective position. The Giallorossi are in fact unwilling to change the agreement that was rreached two days ago and want to sell the player outright or on loan with obligation to buy.

The main obstacle in the path to a positive conclusion to the deal is Spinazzola's conditions. The former Juventus player passed the medical with Inter, however the Nerazzurri asked him to undergo more tests that were supposed to take place at Inter's training facilities this morning. Roma, however, refused to give the green light to additional tests.

For their part, Inter are pondering their options. The Nerazzurri would rather sign the player on loan or on loan with option to buy, without any obligations to make the move permanent at any point of his stay at Inter. In the meanwhile, the players are waiting - Spinazzola in Milan with his agents, Politano in Roma - to understand if the deal will be unlocked or if they will have to go back to their respective clubs on Saturday as the tension between clubs keeps mounting.

Wolves secure Campana signing

Wolves have completed the signing of Ecuador international Leonardo Campana.

The forward, who recently left Barcelona SC, has become Wolves’ first signing of the January transfer window, putting pen to paper on a three-and-a-half-year deal.

The 19-year-old has played four times for the senior Ecuador side and is currently representing his country in the pre-Olympic Championship.

Last year at the South American Under-20 Championship the forward finished the tournament’s top scorer and helped his team lift the trophy.

At club level, Campana stepped up the senior Barcelona SC group in January 2019 and scored his first professional goal against Delfin de Manta three months later.

During last season, which ran throughout 2019, the forward hit four goals in 21 games for Barcelona SC and now makes the switch to Molineux.

Lyon agree to sell Lucas Tousart to Hertha Berlin for €24m, but he’ll move at the end of the season

Le Progrès and L’Équipe report that Lyon have accepted a €24m plus 10% sell-on percentage fee clause offer from German side Hertha Berlin for 22-year-old French youth international defensive midfielder Lucas Tousart.

Tousart is expected to sign a long-term contract with the Bundesliga outfit until 2025, on salary terms that will see him earn around three times more than he currently receives at OL.

The player will however not move until the summer – it is unclear whether OL and Hertha will strike the deal in such a way that he returns on loan to Les Gones until June or if the transfer merely becomes effective at the end of this season.

Atletico Madrid have matched Lyon’s bid for Bruno Guimarães

Lyon’s winter window has taken an unexpected turn this evening with the news that Atletico Madrid have matched the €25m including bonuses + a 20% sell-on percentage fee clause to sign 22-year-old defensive midfielder Bruno Guimarães from Athletico Paranaense, according to L’Équipe and Goal Brazil.

Yesterday, OL concluded an agreement with the Brazilian side, but had yet to finalise personal terms with the player. Atleti’s decision to match Lyon’s proposal means that it is now down to the Brazilian national team captain for the upcoming Olympic Games to choose between the two clubs.

Atleti had a first refusal option arrangement with the Brazilian side, which required Paranaense to inform the Spaniards when they accept an offer for any player.

Nervous few hours ahead for OL.

Inter Milan pick up talks with Olivier Giroud, after Napoli close door on Fernando Llorente

Gianluca di Marzio reports that Inter Milan have today kickstarted conversations with Chelsea and French international forward Olivier Giroud’s agents to get over the line the €6m transfer that they had reached an agreement in principle on last week.

Inter had cooled their interest in this particular deal a few days ago after the possibility of including Spanish striker Fernando Llorente became apparent during their negotiations to move Matteo Politano to Napoli. However, owing to Dries Mertens’ recent injury, de Laurentiis does not want Llorente to leave and as such Politano is joining them on an 18-month loan with a €25m obligation to buy, without any players in exchange.

So, Inter have returned to Giroud, as they look to numerically replace Politano in their squad – talks have moved forward today with all relevant parties. Giroud is expected to earn around €4.5m a year under Antonio Conte’s orders.

Atletico Madrid will make a 2nd offer today to PSG for Edinson Cavani

RMC Sport report that Spanish side Atletico Madrid will make a second formal bid to PSG today for Uruguayan striker Edinson Cavani.

After having a €10m offer in the middle of this month rejected by Les Parisiens, the La Liga side are expected to up the proposal by €5m to €15m.

PSG Sporting Director Leonardo has been seeking €25m, as that would enable Les Parisiens to stay within the confines of FFP regulation – Soccer Link project that the capital club needs to raise €40m in order to align with UEFA’s latest round of checks. A fee of €25m, plus the wages and bonuses that PSG would be due Cavani if he saw out his contract is apparently equal to that amount.

Atletico Madrid are confident that this imminent 2nd bid will be enough to convince PSG to sell the 32-year-old.

As reported over the weekend, Cavani recently rejected an approach from Manchester United, as he wants to join up with Diego Simeone.

N’Zonzi will be recalled by AS Roma from his season-long loan with Galatasaray 6 months early, before being sent back on loan to Rennes until the end of the current campaign.

This will give the ex-Sevilla and Stoke City man a chance to fight for a place at EURO 2020, in a project at Rennes which is seeking to qualify for the Champions’ League.

Sky Sports:
WEST BROM IN TALKS FOR ROBINSON

West Bromwich Albion are in talks with Sheffield United about a deal for striker Callum Robinson, as Slaven Bilic looks to strengthen his attacking options in the pursuit of promotion.

The Championship leaders have failed to score more than once in a game in eight of their last 10 matches - a record that has seen the gap to third-placed Fulham cut to just four points.

Robinson fits the profile of what Bilic is looking for - a versatile, wide attacking player who can both score and create goals.

Albion have been long-time admirers - it is thought they were interested in him before he joined the Blades from Preston last summer.

Chris Wilder is still keen to strengthen his attacking options, and a permanent deal is likely if he can sign a replacement, although a loan option is still being considered.

Inter Milan poised to retain Matias Vecino

Gianluca di Marzio reports that the most likely scenario for 28-year-old Uruguayan midfielder Matias Vecino is that his current club, Inter Milan, will retain him this month.

Antonio Conte and the Inter board are increasingly inclined to retain the player and have decided to involve in their squad for tomorrow night’s Coppa Italia clash with Fiorentina.

The Italian journalist adds that any offers that Nerazzurri have received for the player this month they have deemed inadequate in any case.

This news will come as a blow to Everton, who had been in conversations to sign him, according to reporting elsewhere.

Borussia Dortmund must sell Paco Alcácer before they sign Emre Can, relies on Rodrigo to Barcelona

Borussia Dortmund forward Paco Alcácer has agreed personal terms with former club Valencia, according to Kicker.

The German outlet cites Cadena SER, but add that Borussia would need to sell Alcácer before they can sign Juventus midfielder Emre Can.

One problem that remains is that before Alcácer joins Valencia, the Spanish club must sell Rodrigo, who has been linked with Barcelona to replace the injured Luis Suarez.

With just days remaining in the transfer window, this is one to keep an eye on.

Manchester United in talks with Antero Henrique

As initially reported by TMW and since confirmed by Foot Mercato, ex-PSG Sporting Director Antero Henrique is in talks about taking a position at Premier League side Manchester United.

Minimal details have filtered through on the nature of his possible role with the Red Devils, but it is anticipated that it would be similar to the position he held with PSG.

Henrique was widely chastised for his abrasive personality during his time in the French capital, but he did preside over PSG’s transfer policy when they were able to conclude the signings of Kylian Mbappé and Neymar.

Islam Slimani has asked to leave AS Monaco

France Football report that Algerian international centre forward Islam Slimani has now asked to leave AS Monaco and for the Principality side to cancel his season-long loan from Leicester City six months early.

Slimani is hoping to return to the Premier League this month, with talks ongoing between his entourage and Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United.

Slimani had an awesome first half of the season, being paired with Wissam Ben Yedder, but the ex-Sporting Portugal man is resigned to the fact that new coach Robert Moreno will stick with a 4-3-3 for the remainder of the season and thus prevent him from making consistent starts.

He feels that Monaco have been ungrateful towards him.

Steven N’Zonzi set to join Rennes on loan until the end of the season

Le Parisien confirm Foot Mercato reporting that 31-year-old defensive midfielder Steven N’Zonzi is set to join Rennes on loan until the end of this season.

The World Cup winner’s move should be official in the coming hours, with a source close to the situation having the following to say: “Steven said yes to Rennes for several reasons, notably, the exciting footballing challenge that is being offered to him.”

N’Zonzi will be recalled by AS Roma from his season-long loan with Galatasaray 6 months early, before being sent back on loan to Rennes until the end of the current campaign.

This will give the ex-Sevilla and Stoke City man a chance to fight for a place at EURO 2020, in a project at Rennes which is seeking to qualify for the Champions’ League.

Celta Vigo and West Ham had also made proposals for N’Zonzi.

UPDATE: 18:00 CET: AS Roma have NOT yet agreed on the exact nature of N’Zonzi’s likely loan move to Rennes. The clubs are still negotiating over the amount of the Frenchman’s wages that Rennes will take on from now until the end of the campaign, according to L’Équipe.

Freelance journalist Ignazio Genuardi says to watch out for some last-gasp proposals from Everton and West Ham directly to AS Roma for Steven N’Zonzi. The Frenchman prefers Rennes, but if SRFC can’t satisfy AS Roma’s demands, the Italians might push him to England.

Napoli offer €20m + Amin Younes for Jean-Philippe Mateta

L’Équipe report that Serie A side Napoli have accelerated conversations with German outfit Mainz to sign 22-year-old French striker Jean-Philippe Mateta.

Conversations had already been occurring in earnest last week, but the Italians have stepped things up in recent hours by launching their first formal bid for the Frenchman: €20m + winger Amin Younes in exchange.

It is not yet clear how Mainz will respond to this bid.

Sky Sports:
BARCA OPEN FERNANDES TALKS

Barcelona have opened talks over a deal to sign Manchester United target Bruno Fernandes.

Sky Sports News can confirm reports in Spain that the Catalans have proposed signing the Sporting Lisbon player this summer until 2025, but loan him to Valencia until the end of the 2020-21 season.

Barca are currently in talks with Valencia over a deal to sign striker Rodrigo and reports in Spain say they are hoping this new proposal can help get a deal over the line.

United and Sporting remain apart in their valuations for Fernandes, despite protracted talks over a deal to Old Trafford this month.

News of these discussions could also be viewed as a ‘hurry-up’ to United, with just three days to go of the January window.

SAINTS CONFIDENT ON WALKER-PETERS LOAN

Southampton are confident of completing a loan deal for defender Kyle Walker-Peters today.


STOKE KEEN ON CHESTER

Stoke City are interested in signing Aston Villa defender James Chester as Michael O’Neill looks to bolster his defensive options in this window.

Dean Smith is prepared to allow the 31-year-old to leave Villa Park in this window – his last league appearance for Villa was a year ago; he’s played just two cup games this season.

Stoke are one of a number of Championship clubs interested in the centre back, but it’s thought Chester is keen on the idea of joining Stoke.


WOLVES CONFIDENT ON PODENCE

Wolves are optimistic they can get a deal done for Olympiakos winger Daniel Podence, despite talks between the clubs and player carrying on for almost a week.

Olympiakos are reluctant to sell the former Sporting player, who is still training with his club in Greece, and want at least £21.5m for him.

Talks, however, are ongoing and it’s believed a deal can be reached before Deadline Day.

22-year-old French forward Thierry Ambrose is looking at the possibility of terminating his loan spell at FC Metz six months early, according to sources contacted by Get French Football News.

Talks are also ongoing with a Spanish side that are in the 2nd division but are currently mounting a credible promotion bid.

Milan are evaluating the options regarding Ricardo Rodriguez's future. The deal with Fenerbahce is collapsed, so now the player's agents will head to Milan's headquarters to discuss the future of their client.

Reports from Switzerland suggest that Napoli would be interested in getting the player - as coach Gattuso appreciates the Swiss left-back - but only on loan at the moment. For their part, Milan would only let the player leave in case of an offer that includes also an obligation to buy. During today's meeting, the club and Rodriguez's agent will try to find a solution that could satisfy both the Rossoneri and the player.

Selling Paco Alcácer is not essential for Borussia Dortmund signing Emre Can

Selling Paco Alcácer is not an essential requirement for Borussia Dortmund to sign Emre Can, according to Ruhr Nachrichten.

It had previously suggested that BVB would need to sell Alcácer, who has reportedly agreed terms for a Valencia return, before they are able to sign the 26-year-old Juventus midfielder.

For Valencia to sign Alcácer, it had also been reported that they would have to sell Rodrigo, who’s move to Barcelona has stalled in recent hours, putting Alcácer’s return to Valencia in doubt.

Can has agreed a four-year deal with Borussia Dortmund, according to Bild, with an agreement between the Bundesliga side and Juventus all that remains.

Atletico Madrid inform relevant parties that they won’t up their bid for Edinson Cavani

Le Parisien report that Atlético Madrid have this lunchtime informed the relevant parties that they will not be improving upon their second offer to PSG for Edinson Cavani, which they made yesterday, which was €15m.

The newspaper wonders whether this is the latest negotiating tactic in a long-winded series of talks between PSG and Atlético Madrid that have occurred across this month.

Cavani will not be travelling to face Pau in the Coupe de France this evening, and is still dreaming of making his move to Atleti, but that hope is quickly fading.

Why Chelsea will ‘never’ hire Leicester manager Brendan Rodgers as Blues fume over former Liverpool manager’s ‘big club’ dig

According to The Athletic, Rodgers upset the Blues hierarchy by suggesting he was now at a big club when unveiled as Reds boss in 2012. Not only did he suggest it at his Anfield unveiling in 2012, he repeated it when speaking about Victor Moses — then on loan from Chelsea — a couple of years later.

“It’s not easy when you come to a big club,” he told the Liverpool Echo as he spoke about Moses’ struggle for form. “You come from a really good club like Chelsea to a massive club like Liverpool, where there is expectancy every day.”

It is understood Chelsea haven’t forgotten those comments, nor have they got over Rodgers signing several players on loan and then refusing to pick them.
